title: New Chromium-based Microsoft Edge for Linux
body: I've a request to make new Chromium-based Microsoft Edge web browser compatible with Linux platform also. It's a seriously good browser and we want to try that out on Linux also.

comments.body: it would be nice to use edge on Linux especially for those of us using WSL in our workflows.
Having Microsoft Edge on Linux would save me a lot of hassle as it is the only device I use where I can't use Edge and am forced to use Chrome. This is a blocker in my workflow with bookmarks etc.
yes, this would be wonderful to have!

our dev team uses Linux and time to time we spin VM of Windows 10 to see How it works on Edge.  If we have a Linux Edge, means more Developers will love edge, smooth workflow to test their apps on edge.
Yes, in China we don't use Google, but we love Microsoft.
Hope so too! I don't want to use base Chromium and have to log in to Google to get my favorites, etc.
I really hope this becomes a thing. Microsoft Edge for Linux would be the next best thing to Samsung Internet on Linux for simplifying my computing life.
